complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: FERPA Compliance: Access Controls and Audit Logging
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down FERPA compliance implementation into: (1) access control enforcement, (2) audit logging middleware, (3) log storage schema, (4) log export/search features, (5) least privilege enforcement and endpoint review.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task involves regulatory compliance, robust access control, and comprehensive audit logging. It requires middleware integration, schema design, log management, and UI for log export/search. Testing must cover both authorized and unauthorized access scenarios. The need for least privilege enforcement and export/search features adds technical and process complexity, warranting multiple subtasks.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: (1) field-level encryption implementation, (2) TLS 1.3 configuration and enforcement, (3) Prisma plugin/custom logic integration, (4) Nginx reverse proxy setup and HTTPS enforcement.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Encryption at-rest and in-transit requires careful selection and implementation of algorithms, integration with ORM, and secure network configuration. TLS and HTTPS enforcement across environments, plus field-level encryption, involve multiple layers and dependencies. Testing includes both technical and security validation, making this a moderately complex task.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Frontend Settings Page: Google Sheets Integration Tab
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: (1) OAuth credential upload/validation, (2) spreadsheet ID and sync schedule UI, (3) field mapping interface, (4) manual sync trigger and backend job integration.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Integrating Google Sheets involves OAuth flows, file upload/validation, scheduling, and mapping UI. Each step has distinct technical challenges, especially around authentication and API interaction. Testing must mock external APIs and validate sync flows, justifying several subtasks.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Frontend Settings Page: Automation Settings Tab
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Split into: (1) job scheduling UI and validation, (2) email/SMS template editor with preview, (3) backup schedule and maintenance window configuration.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task covers UI for scheduling, template editing, and maintenance configuration. While each feature is standard, combining them increases complexity. Testing focuses on validation and enforcement, but the technical depth is moderate.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Frontend Settings Page: Backup & Restore Tab
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: (1) backup history display, (2) manual backup/restore triggers and interface, (3) destination configuration and error handling.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Backup and restore features require UI for history, triggers, and configuration. Error handling and warnings add some complexity, but the implementation follows common patterns. Testing is straightforward with mock data.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: (1) layout and navigation optimization, (2) table and form mobile adaptations, (3) touch/gesture enhancements and device testing.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Mobile optimization involves layout changes, navigation redesign, and touch/gesture support. While Tailwind and Framer Motion simplify some aspects, thorough device testing and UI adaptation are required. The task is mostly UI-focused but covers multiple components.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: List subtasks for: (1) API integration testing, (2) barcode/QR UI implementation, (3) CSV/Excel import, (4) session limit enforcement, (5) photo upload, (6) activity tracking and integration testing.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This module involves multiple features (CRUD, barcode/QR, import, session limits, photo upload, activity tracking) with real API integration and caching. Each feature has distinct technical and testing requirements, making the overall task complex and requiring granular subtasks.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: (1) real-time status tracking (WebSocket), (2) session assignment/reservation UI, (3) maintenance scheduling (Bull), (4) analytics/report generation, (5) conflict and accuracy testing.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Real-time updates, session assignment, maintenance scheduling, and analytics/reporting each require backend, frontend, and real-time integration. WebSocket and Bull add complexity, and testing must cover concurrency and data accuracy.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: USB Scanner Integration and Multi-Device Sync
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: (1) scanner input parsing and device integration, (2) duplicate prevention logic (Redis), (3) feedback UI/UX, (4) WebSocket event broadcasting and sync.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Integrating hardware (USB scanner), parsing multiple code types, preventing duplicates, and syncing across devices via WebSocket involves hardware, backend, and frontend coordination. Each aspect is technically distinct and requires focused implementation and testing.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down into: (1) dashboard UI and chart integration, (2) backend metrics aggregation, (3) report generation/export (CSV, PDF, JSON), (4) custom query builder with dynamic filters.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Analytics and reporting require both frontend (charts, UI) and backend (aggregation, export) work. Custom query builder adds complexity, as does supporting multiple export formats. Testing must cover data accuracy and export correctness.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: (1) DB indexing and query optimization, (2) connection pooling tuning, (3) Redis caching and ETag implementation, (4) compression and rate limiting, (5) monitoring setup (Prometheus/Grafana).
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Backend optimization spans database, caching, API, and monitoring. Each area requires specialized knowledge and careful testing. The breadth of optimizations and need for benchmarking increase complexity.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: (1) bundle size reduction and code splitting, (2) lazy loading and tree shaking, (3) image optimization, (4) React performance tuning (memoization, virtual scrolling).
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Frontend optimization involves build tooling, component architecture, and asset management. Each area is well-supported by modern frameworks, but requires careful configuration and testing for measurable impact.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: (1) Bull queue configuration (priority, retry), (2) monitoring dashboard setup (bull-board), (3) failed job handling and alerting.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Optimizing background jobs is a focused backend task. Bull and bull-board provide standard patterns, but configuration and monitoring require attention. The scope is moderate, with clear subtasks.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: List: (1) backend unit tests (Vitest), (2) frontend unit tests (React Testing Library), (3) integration tests for API/UI, (4) coverage analysis and gap remediation, (5) mocking external dependencies.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Achieving >80% coverage across backend and frontend, with integration and mocking, is a significant effort. It requires coordination, coverage analysis, and remediation, making it a high-complexity task.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: End-to-End Testing and Multi-Device Sync Validation
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: (1) E2E test suite setup (Playwright/Cypress), (2) workflow coverage (check-in/out, settings, reporting), (3) multi-device scenario simulation, (4) authentication/error case testing.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: E2E testing covers full workflows, device sync, and error handling. Multi-device scenarios and CI integration add complexity, but modern tools streamline much of the process.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand into: (1) automated vulnerability scanning, (2) manual penetration testing, (3) JWT validation and security header implementation, (4) SQL injection and XSS prevention, (5) remediation and retesting.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Security testing and hardening is critical and multifaceted, covering automated and manual approaches, multiple attack vectors, and remediation. Each aspect requires specialized expertise and thorough validation.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: (1) firewall rule setup and validation, (2) VPN configuration for remote admin, (3) documentation of network configuration.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Network and firewall configuration is a standard DevOps task, but must be precise and well-documented. VPN setup adds some complexity, but overall scope is moderate.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: (1) API and DB schema documentation, (2) ADRs and deployment guides, (3) user guides and troubleshooting, (4) developer docs (README, contributing, code style, testing).
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Comprehensive documentation spans technical, user, and developer audiences. Generating and validating docs for multiple areas requires coordination, but follows established patterns and tools.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: (1) quick start guides and checklists, (2) video tutorial creation, (3) in-app onboarding flow and feedback collection.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Training and onboarding materials require content creation and UI integration. While important, the technical complexity is moderate and follows standard practices.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Production Readiness Review and Go-Live Checklist
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Divide into: (1) success criteria verification, (2) go-live checklist execution, (3) initial production monitoring (logs, metrics), (4) incident response plan preparation.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Production readiness involves cross-functional review, checklist execution, monitoring, and incident planning. It requires coordination across modules and thorough validation, making it a complex but well-defined task.
